items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Polars plugins / Geographical / Spatial

*   [polars-st (‚≠ê105)](https://github.com/Oreilles/polars-st) - Polars plugin that provides geographical/spatial operations on Polars DataFrames, Series, and Expressions by [@Oreilles](https://github.com/Oreilles).

### Polars plugins / Validation

*   [polars-validator (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/baggiponte/polars-validator) - Polars plugin that makes Polars DataFrames generics by [@baggiponte](https://github.com/baggiponte).

### Polars plugins / String parsing

*   [polars-url (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/condekind/polars-url) - Polars plugin to parse/extract fields from urls by [@condekind](https://github.com/condekind).
*   [polars\_iptools (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/erichutchins/polars_iptools) - Polars plugin for IP address parsing and enrichment including geolocation by [@erichutchins](https://github.com/erichutchins).

### Polars plugins / Text similarity / Fuzzy Matching

*   [polars-distance (‚≠ê76)](https://github.com/ion-elgreco/polars-distance) - Polars plugin for text similarity/pairwise distance functions by [@ion-elgreco](https://github.com/ion-elgreco).
*   [polars\_sim (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/schemaitat/polars_sim) - Polars plugin that implements fast approximate joins on string columns for polars dataframes by [@schemaitat](https://github.com/schemaitat).

### Polars plugins / Time series / Datetime

*   [polars-xdt (‚≠ê211)](https://github.com/pola-rs/polars-xdt) - Polars plugin with extra-datetime-related functionalities by [@MarcoGorelli](https://github.com/MarcoGorelli).

### Polars plugins / Machine Learning & Data Science

*   [polars-ml (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/barak1412/polars_ml) - Polars plugin for machine learning by [@barak1412](https://github.com/barak1412).
*   [polars-candle (‚≠ê25)](https://github.com/wdoppenberg/polars-candle) - Polars plugin for running [candle (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/huggingface/candle) ML models on Polars DataFrames by [@wdoppenberg](https://github.com/wdoppenberg).

### Polars plugins / Mathematical & Statistical Functions

*   [polars\_ols (‚≠ê166)](https://github.com/azmyrajab/polars_ols) - Polars plugin that enables fast linear model Polar expressions by [@azmyrajab](https://github.com/azmyrajab).
*   [polars-pairing (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/apcamargo/polars-pairing) - Polars plugin that provides pairing functions that encode two natural numbers into a single natural number by [@apcamargo](https://github.com/apcamargo).

### Polars plugins / General utilities / Performance

*   [polars-utils (‚≠ê13)](https://github.com/junghoon-son/polars-utils) - Collection of utilities for data exploration and analysis with Polars DataFrames by [@junghoon-son](https://github.com/junghoon-son).
*   [harley (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/TomBurdge/harley) - Polars helper methods to enhance developer productivity by [@TomBurdge](https://github.com/TomBurdge).
*   [polars-config-meta (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/lmmx/polars-config-meta) - Polars plugin for persistent DataFrame-level metadata by [@lmmx](https://github.com/lmmx).

### Polars plugins / Miscellaneous

*   [polars-finance (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/ngriffiths13/polars-finance) - A collection of Python Polars plugins and functions for market data processing by [@ngriffiths13](https://github.com/ngriffiths13).
*   [polars\_encryption (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/zlobendog/polars_encryption) - Polars plugin that extends Polars with encryption algorithm AES-GSM-SIV by [@zlobendog](https://github.com/zlobendog).
*   [polars-bio (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/biodatageeks/polars-bio) - Polars plugin for large-scale genomic analyses which is easy to use and considerable faster and more scalabe than existing alternatives by [@biodatageeks](https://github.com/biodatageeks).
items.content_html:
Polars plugins / Geographical / Spatial

  • polars-st (‚≠ê105) - Polars plugin that provides geographical/spatial operations on Polars DataFrames, Series, and Expressions by @Oreilles.

Polars plugins / Validation

  • polars-validator (‚≠ê15) - Polars plugin that makes Polars DataFrames generics by @baggiponte.

Polars plugins / String parsing

  • polars-url (‚≠ê6) - Polars plugin to parse/extract fields from urls by @condekind.
  • polars_iptools (‚≠ê21) - Polars plugin for IP address parsing and enrichment including geolocation by @erichutchins.

Polars plugins / Text similarity / Fuzzy Matching

  • polars-distance (‚≠ê76) - Polars plugin for text similarity/pairwise distance functions by @ion-elgreco.
  • polars_sim (‚≠ê13) - Polars plugin that implements fast approximate joins on string columns for polars dataframes by @schemaitat.

Polars plugins / Time series / Datetime

  • polars-xdt (‚≠ê211) - Polars plugin with extra-datetime-related functionalities by @MarcoGorelli.

Polars plugins / Machine Learning & Data Science

  • polars-ml (‚≠ê13) - Polars plugin for machine learning by @barak1412.
  • polars-candle (‚≠ê25) - Polars plugin for running candle (‚≠ê18k) ML models on Polars DataFrames by @wdoppenberg.

Polars plugins / Mathematical & Statistical Functions

  • polars_ols (‚≠ê166) - Polars plugin that enables fast linear model Polar expressions by @azmyrajab.
  • polars-pairing (‚≠ê12) - Polars plugin that provides pairing functions that encode two natural numbers into a single natural number by @apcamargo.

Polars plugins / General utilities / Performance

  • polars-utils (‚≠ê13) - Collection of utilities for data exploration and analysis with Polars DataFrames by @junghoon-son.
  • harley (‚≠ê9) - Polars helper methods to enhance developer productivity by @TomBurdge.
  • polars-config-meta (‚≠ê9) - Polars plugin for persistent DataFrame-level metadata by @lmmx.

Polars plugins / Miscellaneous

  • polars-finance (‚≠ê46) - A collection of Python Polars plugins and functions for market data processing by @ngriffiths13.
  • polars_encryption (‚≠ê8) - Polars plugin that extends Polars with encryption algorithm AES-GSM-SIV by @zlobendog.
  • polars-bio (‚≠ê69) - Polars plugin for large-scale genomic analyses which is easy to use and considerable faster and more scalabe than existing alternatives by @biodatageeks.

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Concepts / AI Concept Representation

*   [ImageBind: One Embedding Space To Bind Them All](https://openaccess.thecvf.com/content/CVPR2023/html/Girdhar_ImageBind_One_Embedding_Space_To_Bind_Them_All_CVPR_2023_paper.html) - ***CVPR'23***, 2023. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=1657173986906232916)]. \[[Project (‚≠ê8.7k)](https://github.com/facebookresearch/ImageBind)]. This work presents ImageBind, an approach to learn a joint embedding across six different modalities - images, text, audio, depth, thermal, and IMU data. The authors show that all combinations of paired data are not necessary to train such a joint embedding, and only image-paired data is sufficient to bind the modalities together. ImageBind can leverage recent large scale vision-language models, and extends their zero-shot capabilities to new modalities just by using their natural pairing with images. It enables novel emergent applications 'out-of-the-box' including cross-modal retrieval, composing modalities with arithmetic, cross-modal detection and generation. The emergent capabilities improve with the strength of the image encoder and this work sets a new state-of-the-art on emergent zero-shot recognition tasks across modalities, outperforming specialist supervised models. Finally, the authors show strong few-shot recognition results outperforming prior work, and that ImageBind serves as a new way to evaluate vision models for visual and non-visual tasks.
items.content_html:
Concepts / AI Concept Representation

  • ImageBind: One Embedding Space To Bind Them All - CVPR'23, 2023. [All Versions]. [Project (‚≠ê8.7k)]. This work presents ImageBind, an approach to learn a joint embedding across six different modalities - images, text, audio, depth, thermal, and IMU data. The authors show that all combinations of paired data are not necessary to train such a joint embedding, and only image-paired data is sufficient to bind the modalities together. ImageBind can leverage recent large scale vision-language models, and extends their zero-shot capabilities to new modalities just by using their natural pairing with images. It enables novel emergent applications 'out-of-the-box' including cross-modal retrieval, composing modalities with arithmetic, cross-modal detection and generation. The emergent capabilities improve with the strength of the image encoder and this work sets a new state-of-the-art on emergent zero-shot recognition tasks across modalities, outperforming specialist supervised models. Finally, the authors show strong few-shot recognition results outperforming prior work, and that ImageBind serves as a new way to evaluate vision models for visual and non-visual tasks.
